fullText:
https://www.wsj.com/articles/back-to-the-future-the-musical-review-docs-delorean-on-broadway-silvestri-roger-bart-f9a2349d

Roger Bart and Casey Likes Matthew Murphy and Evan ZimmermanNew York

In the unlikely event that I find myself inside a plutonium-fueled DeLorean—I suppose today it would be a Tesla—capable of transporting me to the past, and thus enabling me to alter my future, fairly high on the list of life changes I’d consider would be somehow avoiding having to view the sluggish slog that is the stage adaptation of “Back to the Future.”

‘The Queen of Versailles’ Review: Kristin Chenoweth’s Musical of Gilded Dreams
showScoreExcerpt: The musical has been staged in lavish style...And the DeLorean, with its glowing neon trim, has been glamorized effectively...But the musical as a whole never achieves liftoff, or even the stage equivalent of 88 miles an hour. It cruises along in a low gear for almost three hours.
bwwExcerpt: avoiding having to view the sluggish slog that is the stage adaptation

keyPhrases.quote: sluggish slog that is the stage adaptation
musical as a whole never achieves liftoff
cruises along in a low gear for almost three hours

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Despite acknowledging lavish production values and effective staging elements, the critic fundamentally characterizes the show as a 'sluggish slog' that fails to engage, making it difficult to recommend. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses strong dissatisfaction with the overall experience of the musical, indicating a clear rejection of the adaptation.
